intro: Aporum suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented aporum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive fragrance when crushed. Aporum suaveolens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
